Specifiche esperienze professionali cara.content: October 1999 – January 2000: Quantitative Analyst at Risk Management Division of Banca Unicredit, Milan. VaR computation for derivatives portfolios (FX desk, Repo desk). Extreme Value Theory and stress testing. Passport options valuation.

Organizzazione o partecipazione come rel.content: “Change of numeraire and American options”, Quantitative Risk Management Conference, Carnegie Mellon University, PITTSBURGH (USA), August 2000, https://www.math.cmu.edu/cna/CNAevents/ccf/conferences.html
“Change of numeraire and American options”, II Workshop di Finanza Matematica, Università di Pisa (Italy), February 2001.
“Change of numeraire and American options”, Workshop on Probability Theory and Applications, Department of Mathematics, Università di Bologna (Italy), February 2001.
“No Arbitrage for asset derivatives with discrete stochastic dividends”, SAET (Society for the Advancement of Economic Theory), Ischia (Italy), July 2001.

“Quadratic Hedging for asset derivatives with discrete stochastic dividends”, Meeting AMASES, Firenze (Italy), September 2001, http://www.amases.org/events/amases-annu al-conferences1/icalrepeat.detail/2001/0 9/05/41/-/xxv-convegno-amases
“No Arbitrage for asset derivatives with discrete stochastic dividends”, Summer School in Mathematical Finance, DUBROVNIK (CROATIA), September 2001
“Quadratic Hedging for asset derivatives with discrete stochastic dividends”, III workshop di Finanza Matematica, Università di Verona (Italy), January 2002.

“Quadratic Hedging for asset derivatives with discrete stochastic dividends”, 6th International Congress on Insurance: Mathematics & Economics, ISEG, Technical University of LISBON (PORTUGAL), July 2002

“Dividends and uncertainty: the Italian market”, Meeting AMASES, Verona (Italy), September 2002, http://www.amases.org/events/amases-annu al-conferences1/icalrepeat.detail/2002/0 9/11/42/-/xxvi-convegno-amases
“Dividends and uncertainty: the Italian market”, First EMS -SMAI -SMF Joint Conference Applied Mathematics and Applications of Mathematics, NICE (FRANCE), February 2003

“Dividends and uncertainty: the Italian market”, 7th International Congress on Insurance: Mathematics & Economics, ISFA, University Claude Bernard, LYON (FRANCE), June 2003, https://www.univ-lyon1.fr/research/labor atory-of-actuarial-and-financial-science s-saf--813473.kjsp

“Optimal stopping with exercise restrictions”, Meeting AMASES 2003, Cagliari (Italy), September 2003, http://www.amases.org/events/amases-annu al-conferences1/icalrepeat.detail/2003/0 9/03/15/-/xxvii-convegno-amases
“Optimal stopping and American options with discrete dividends and exogenous risk”, Third World Bachelier Conference, CHICAGO (USA), July 2004, http://www.bacheliercongress.com/2004/
ORGANIZZATORE: VI Workshop Quantitative Finance, Bocconi University, January 27 - 28, 2005.

“Dynamic versus one-period completeness in event-tree security markets”, Meeting AMASES 2005, Palermo (Italy), September 2005, http://www.amases.org/events/amases-annu al-conferences1/icalrepeat.detail/2005/0 9/12/13/-/xxix-convegno-amases

“Closed-form optimal investment when present values and costs are jump-diffusions”, Meeting AMASES 2006, Trieste (Italy), September 2006, http://www.amases.org/events/amases-annu al-conferences1/icalrepeat.detail/2006/0 9/04/12/-/xxx-convegno-amases
"The double continuation region”, Amamef conference on Numerical Methods in Finance, Udine, Italy, June 2008
ORGANIZZATORE: Workshop in honor of Professor Maurizio Pratelli, Dipartimento di Matematica per le Scienze Economiche e Sociali "Matemates", Università di Bologna, 9 October 2010

“Real options and American derivatives: the double continuation region”, Stochastic Methods in Financial Markets, Faculty of Mathematics and Physics of University of LJUBLJANA (SLOVENIA), August 2011, http://conferences2.imfm.si/internalPage.py?pageId=9&confId=4

“The geometry of the double continuation region”, Workshop on optimal stopping and applications, Department of Mathematics "G. Peano", University of Torino, May 2015, https://sites.google.com/site/workshopoptimalstopping/
“On the exercise of American quanto options”, XVII Workshop on Quantitative Finance, University of Milano Bicocca, January 2017, https://sites.google.com/site/qfw2017/
ORGANIZZATORE: Workshop in honor of Professor Maurizio Pratelli, Dipartimento di Matematica, Università di Pisa, 29 June 2018

Conseguimento di premi e riconoscimenti.content: Research fellowship “Mathematical and Numerical Analysis of Differential Equations” at the Department of Mathematics and Computer Science, University of Udine (Italy)

Vincitrice di una borsa di studio Borsa di studio finanziata dalla Fondazione Gasbarri e dalla Fondazione Assicurazioni Generali per la frequenza al Corso di Perfezionamento in Matematica, indirizzo Scienze Finanziarie e Assicurative presso la Scuola Normale Superiore di Pisa

Partecipazione al collegio dei docenti o.content: PARTECIPAZIONE AL COLLEGIO DEI DOCENTI DEL DOTTORATO di FINANZA, Università Commerciale "Luigi Bocconi" MILANO, DOT0656119, Anno 2006 - Ciclo: XXII - Durata: 4 anni

INSEGNAMENTO: Continuous-Time Finance 1st module, (24 hours), PhD in Economics and Finance, Bocconi University, since a.y. 2007/08 (Maternal leave in a.y. 2012/13). PhD school excellence teaching award for the course in a.y. 2016/17.

Direzione o partecipazione alle attivit\.content: PRIN Supermodularità e misure di rischio (Partecipante). Coordinatore scientifico Marinacci Massimo.
PRIN Modelli per la gestione del rischio finanziario e di credito (Partecipante). Coordinatore scientifico Peccati Lorenzo.
PRIN Teoria robusta della scelta, analisi media-varianza e misure di rischio (Partecipante). Coordinatore scientifico Maccheroni Fabio.
PRIN Invidia, equità, reciprocità, e incertezza nelle decisioni sociali (Partecipante). Coordinatore scientifico Li Calzi Marco.

Formale attribuzione di incarichi di ins.content: Academic Guest at the Department of Mathematics, Insurance mathematics and stochastic finance group, Eidgenössische Technische Hochschule Zürich, Switzerland (invited by prof. P.Embrechts)
IGIER fellow - Innocenzo Gasparini Institute for Economic Research, Bocconi University, Italy
